summary: This document is an email chain between staff at multiple Federal Bureau of Prisons (BOP) facilities discussing technical issues and opinions regarding the NICEVision camera/security system. The emails are dated August 8-12, 2019, and originate from facilities including the Federal Detention Center in Miami, FCI Victorville, FCI Danbury, and FCI Otisville. The primary topic is a software/database error with the NICEVision system, with speculation that it may be related to a Windows 10 upgrade.

events.title: NICEVision System Installation at FCI Victorville
events.description: FCI Victorville reports having the NICEVision camera system installed.

events.title: NICEVision System Update at FCI Victorville
events.description: FCI Victorville received an update to their NICEVision system.

events.title: Viconet System Replacement at ECI 2
events.description: A Viconet system at ECI 2 was replaced with a NICEVision system.

events.title: NICEVision Administrator Database Error Reported
events.description: A staff member at FCI Otisville reports a 'Database Error' when trying to log into the NICEVision Administrator to unlock an account, causing the application to close.

events.title: Email Chain on NICEVision Issues
events.description: An email chain circulates among BOP facilities discussing the NICEVision system error, with speculation it is related to a Windows upgrade, and sharing experiences with the system.

locations: FEDERAL DETENTION CENTER 33 NE 4TH STREET MIAMI, FL 33132
Federal Bureau of Prisons FCC Victorville. CA 92301
F.C.I. Danbury 33'/ Pembroke Road Route 37 Danbur , Ct. 06811-3099

keyFacts: The document is an internal BOP email chain dated August 8-12, 2019, discussing the NICEVision security camera system.
A significant technical issue is reported: a 'Database Error' that prevents administrator login and crashes the NICEVision application at FCI Otisville.
Multiple BOP facilities (Miami, Victorville, Danbury, Otisville) participate in the discussion, comparing their experiences with NICEVision and other systems like Pelco and Viconet.
There is speculation among staff that the software error may be related to a BOP-wide Windows 10 operating system transition/upgrade.
The tone of the emails is technical and operational, focused on prison security infrastructure, with no direct mention of Jeffrey Epstein, his case, or any related individuals.
